original_solution_mapping.L1: Madeline needs to buy 2*20=<<2*20=40>>40 seeds to make sure that she will have 20 flowers.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Thus, Madeline will need to buy 2 packs of flowers to have at least 40 seeds.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, Madeline will spend 2*5=$<<2*5=10>>10 on seeds.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3093.
    Returns: the total cost Madeline will spend on seeds.
    """
    # L1
    flowers_needed = 20 # plant 20 flowers
    death_rate_multiplier = 2 # about half of the seeds she plants will die
    seeds_to_plant = death_rate_multiplier * flowers_needed

    # L2
    seeds_per_pack = 25 # 25 seeds per pack
    packs_needed = (seeds_to_plant + seeds_per_pack - 1) // seeds_per_pack

    # L3
    cost_per_pack = 5 # Each pack is $5
    total_cost = packs_needed * cost_per_pack

    # FA
    answer = total_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Madeline needs to buy {death_rate_multiplier}*{flowers_needed}=<<{death_rate_multiplier}*{flowers_needed}={seeds_to_plant}>>{seeds_to_plant} seeds to make sure that she will have {flowers_needed} flowers.
Thus, Madeline will need to buy {packs_needed} packs of flowers to have at least {seeds_to_plant} seeds.
Thus, Madeline will spend {packs_needed}*{cost_per_pack}=${packs_needed}*{cost_per_pack}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} on seeds.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Madeline needs to buy 2*20=<<2*20=40>>40 seeds to make sure that she will have 20 flowers.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'seeds_to_plant' (value: 40) was reported instead of 'total_cost' (value: 10).
